qas.question: Sir George Somers embarked on a mission to do what?
The devastating wreck of the flotilla is said to have inspired what playwrite?
How long did Sommer's settlers stay in Bermuda?
Who did Sommer's claim the island for?
Where was a colony established in 1706?

plausible_answers.text: flotilla was broken up by a storm

qas.question: What did 229 passengers and a dog survive?

context: It established <b4_0>a colony at <b5_0>Jamestown, Virginia<b5_0/><b4_0/>, in 1607. Two years later, a flotilla of seven ships left England under the <b7_0>Company's Admiral<b7_0/>, Sir George Somers, and the new <b6_0>Governor of Jamestown<b6_0/>, Sir Thomas Gates, with several hundred settlers, food and supplies to <a0_0>relieve the colony of Jamestown<a0_0/>. Somers had previous experience sailing with both Sir Francis Drake and Sir Walter Raleigh. The <b8_0>flotilla was broken up by a storm<b8_0/>. As the flagship, the Sea Venture, was taking on water, Somers drove it onto Bermuda's reef and gained the shores safely with smaller boats – all 150 passengers and a dog survived. (<a1_0>William Shakespeare<a1_0/>'s play The Tempest, in which the character Ariel refers to the "still-vex'd Bermoothes" (I.ii.229), is thought to have been inspired by William Strachey's account of this shipwreck.) They stayed <a2_0>10 months<a2_0/>, starting a new settlement and building two small ships to sail to Jamestown. The island was claimed for <a3_0>the English Crown<a3_0/>, and the charter of the Virginia Company was later extended to include it.
